intro: Gossypium hypadenum, commonly known as the narrowleaf cotton or narrowleaf cottonweed, is a flowering plant species native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other cotton species and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is typically found in rocky soils and can thrive in harsh, drought conditions. Gossypium hypadenum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
